document_notes.text:
This update for gd fixes the following security issues:

- CVE-2016-9317: The gdImageCreate function in the GD Graphics Library
  (aka libgd) allowed remote attackers to cause a denial of service
  (system hang) via an oversized image.  (bsc#1022283)
- CVE-2016-10167: A denial of service problem in gdImageCreateFromGd2Ctx()
  could lead to libgd running out of memory even on small files. (bsc#1022264)
- CVE-2016-10168: A signed integer overflow in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) could lead
  to memory corruption (bsc#1022265)
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: The gdImageCreateFromGd2Ctx function in gd_gd2.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted image file.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4:gd-2.0.36.RC1-52.32.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 11 SP4:gd-devel-2.0.36.RC1-52.32.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Integer overflow in gd_io.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.4 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving the number of horizontal and vertical chunks in an image.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
